Two-dimentional PCA plot with the PC annotation

Source: R/plotAnnotedPCA.R
plotAnnotatedPCA.Rd

Two-dimentional PCA plot with the PC annotation

plotAnnotatedPCA(
  dataset,
  PCAmodel,
  PCs,
  val_all = NULL,
  scoreCutoff = 0.5,
  nesCutoff = NULL,
  color_by = NULL,
  color_lab = NULL,
  trimed_pathway_len = 45
)

Arguments

dataset

An expression matrix with genes (rows) x samples (columns)
PCAmodel

PCAGenomicSignatures-class object
PCs

A numeric vector length of 2. It should be between 1 and 8.
val_all

The output from validate
scoreCutoff

A numeric value for the minimum correlation. Default is 0.5.
nesCutoff

A numeric value for the minimum NES. Default is NULL and the suggested value is 3.
color_by

A named vector with the feature you want to color by. Name should be match with the sample names of the dataset.
color_lab

A name for color legend. If this argument is not provided, the color legend will be labeld as "Color By" by default.
trimed_pathway_len

Positive inter values, which is the display width of pathway names. Default is 45.

Value

Scatter plot and the table with annotation. If enriched pathway didn't pass the scoreCutoff the table will be labeled as "No significant pathways". If any enriched pathway didn't pass the nesCutoff, it will labeled as NA.

Contents
